result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa Jane Kovach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).
  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court makes ruling, cannot grant exemption for stated reasons (statute), can send the form to reduce price of IID if defendant so wishes. Kovach will call COC for form. Adjourned at 8:48 AM.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lisa Jane Kovach in court with attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus appears telephonically with leave of the court.  Defendant Lisa Jane Kovach in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:03 AM. State - here for clarification for credit on sentence. Cveykus agrees - argues for 7 days credit on her sentence as opposed to getting credit only if revoked. Court reviews file - 7 days credit to be applied to the 45 days sentence on the OWI charge. Clerk will modify JOC, eligible for good time, huber and community service under 973.03(3) on the jail time on the OWI. Adjourned at 11:06 AM.
for Ignition Interlock Exemptions and Removing Title Transfer Stops
Defendant's Motion for Jail Credit and Exemption from IID
Defendant's

Defendant Lisa Jane Kovach in court with attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:31 PM. Here for motion hearing - jail credit and IID. State has no objections to 7 days of jail credit. Court grants 7 days jail credit and amend JOC. Cveykus - there are 3 vehicles that he would like to be excluded from IID and asking court to accept testimony from defendant. Cveykus calls Lisa Kovach to testify, 3:34 PM. Direct by Cveykus. Court questions defendant. Court will grant exemption due to financial hardship, instructs she must have IID installed in any other vehicle registered in her name or operation of any vehicle. Clerk to fax Order to DMV.
From Attorney Cveykus requesting Order for Ignition Interlock Exemptions - Judge requests testimony under oath.

#1 & #2 - JOC's from 14CF90

Defendant Lisa Jane Kovach in court with attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:16 PM. State - resolved - counts #1 and #3 - DRI, #4 - joint recommendation of G plea with probation for 2 years with conditions of: $500 fine plus costs and surcharge, AODA and follow thru, psychological assessment with follow thru, restitution of $35.00 to FOSO for blood draw, absolute sobriety to include no impairment from any substance unless prescribed by a treating physician, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 100 hours of community service; count #2 - plead to as alleged, acknowledge two prior convictions, 1 year in FC jail - stayed, place on probation for 2 years probation with same conditions and additional conditions of: 24 month DL revocation, IID for 2 years, $1744.00 fine, 45 days of conditional jail, defense is free to argue for 14 days of conditional jail option under guidelines. Cveykus and Kovach agree. Court dismisses and reads in counts #1 and #3. Kovach pleads G to counts #2 and #4. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. Cveykus will be arguing for time to report, acknowledges 2 prior convictions. Court accepts exhibits #1 and #2 after no objections (2:26 PM). State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation and his recommendation of 45 days of conditional jail. Cveykus makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation and asks for 14 days of conditional jail. Kovach makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: $500 fine plus costs - take bond posted and remainder due thru P&P, AODA and follow thru, continue with any psychiatric or counseling that she is currently involved in and follow thru, take all medications as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed, reimburse $35.00 to arresting agency (FOSO) for blood draw, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 100 hours of community service; #2 - impose 1 year in FC jail, stayed, place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to count #4, with same conditions as count #4 except $1744.00 fine, no additional community service, revoke license for 2 years, IID for 2 years on DL and any vehicles titled in her name commencing upon issuance of valid DL, 45 days in FC jail - huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.09(3) - report no later than 8:30 AM on 3/11/16, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, right to appeal, adjourned.

Final pre-trial at 12-02-2015 02:45 pm

Defendant Lisa Jane Kovach in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Defendant Lisa Jane Kovach in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:41 PM. State - here for a PH and believe it is going to be waived and have filed an Information that mirrors the complaint in anticipation of that. Kelz and Kovach agree. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Kelz has Information, waives reading and will move forth to ARGN, pleads NG to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, explains to defense counsel the procedure in FC for setting the matter for a FPT. Counsel understands. Klez asks procedure regarding the time limits for filing of motions. Court and State respond.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
